page.title: 01ATTITUDES
page.content: The village housing has increased greatly but not so the population. This has mainly been due to the type of development which was tailored towards the greater wealth of "London" people, many of whom are retired. This has led to major problems in village life. The original close knit community which is very warm hearted was confronted with elderly people who wanted total privacy, or affluent families who expected the amenities they had in city life and more. The new inhabitants to a large degree expected the community to fit in with them and not themselves fitting into a rural environment. Another major division is between the young and old. The teenage bracket of the population find themselves with little to do. To solve the problems needs a unified approach.
